content: I heard this during the news on the radio this morning. In November (in time for Christmas giving) they be marketing a periphreal device for the I-POD. Get this it's for busy parent to help train thier kids to go potty. It's called the I-POO'D and you can program the damn to at set times encourage yur child to go to the tolet and do his or her "businees". The whole time it offers encouragement and praise to the toddler. They're also talking a a future upgrade that will connect to you WI-FI and send out an email to a list of people you select indicating a sucessful trip to the bathroom. Incredible! What the hell, parents are soon going to be obsolete and replaced by 'puters and robots !!!???

title: New device for parents  .. Are they being REPLACED by TECHNOLOGY!?

content: Computer games and ipod stuff is becoming their world while "parents" are off somewhere else. The new society doesn't even think a child needs "parents". One might do, or two of the same sex - or maybe a good dog, so the "parents" can be elsewhere. Daycare can do it. Start kids in school at 2... ... Kids are cast adrift...\\ Kinds of reminds me of the experiments done in the 1800s when they put several baby children in isolation in an environment to see what would happen. Of course, they expected the kids to spontaneously learn the Adamic language, interact and start civilizing themselves. What happened was that the children became animals, and once the scientists decided to end the experiment, the children were damaged beyond repair. They never learned language or human motor skills, like using spoons to eat, or dressing themselves, or proper hygiene, because all of that has to be impressed into the developing brain in the first stages of growth - as with conscience and compassion. Though the children could be dressed and cared for, they remained no different than tigers and gorillas: brutal, selfish, and aggressive... Does that tell you something of the behavior of teenagers today? Being human is learned, not instinctive - and parents must warmly and firmly give it to their young - - Wandering and Wondering
